column4: my executable creates a file that is supposed to go beside it, but when i run it from a desktop launcher, it creates the file @home
mostliky the program creates the file in the current working doirectory
how do i change it?
how do i change the working path of an application?
if you change to the diretory of the executable then run it, is the file created there?
even if you cd to the executable dir first and run it from there?
how exactly do you create that file?
if i run it from the directory where the app is, it works fine
i would like to cd into the directory, gnome-terminal -e <myapp> all in one launcher...
so thats the problem, i guess the starter doesnt do/support that, write a start shellscript that does whatever you need before actualy starting the app, i dont know of a better way
yes, i'm doing it... using a .sh as a windows .bat
i made a .sh file ( i gues that it is like a windows .bat <batch executable>
yeah that should work out
i get permission denied....
yeah you didnt set the executable bit on the file
how do i make that?
do something like chmod a+x myshellscript
now it runs, but i don't see results
now it works without the chmod.... i guess i changed the folder/file permissions...
totally fixed.. thanks
